images.title: Village Struck by Drought
images.description: A small Indian village suffers under a brutal drought. Rohan, a kind-hearted boy, walks with his grandmother past cracked earth and wilted crops.

images.title: Discovery of the Golden Mango
images.description: Rohan finds a lone mango tree in the forest, its branches holding a single glowing golden mango. The tree’s leaves shimmer magically.

images.title: The Tree’s Message
images.description: The mango tree speaks to Rohan, its voice gentle. Rohan listens intently as it says, 'Share my mango, and I will give more.'

images.title: Rohan Shares the Mango
images.description: Rohan cuts the golden mango into pieces, distributing it to hungry villagers. Their faces light up with gratitude.

images.title: The Tree’s Bounty
images.description: At dawn, the tree is laden with golden mangoes. Villagers gather joyfully, filling baskets with the magical fruit.

images.title: Greed man
images.description: A greedy man hoards mangoes, ignoring the tree’s warning.

images.title: The Tree’s Departure
images.description: The tree shakes violently and vanishes into the sky, leaving the man empty-handed.

images.title: Meena by the River
images.description: Meena, a young girl, sits by the riverbank, watching the water flow gently.

images.title: Meena Cleans the River
images.description: Meena uses a tree branch to clean the river, removing debris and trash.

images.title: The River is smiling
images.description: The river smiles at Meena, thanking her for her kindness.

images.title: The River's gift
images.description: The river gives Meena a gift, a golden fish.

images.title: Meena's Joyful Home with golden fish
images.description: Meena's home is filled with joy, as she and her family enjoy the golden fish.

images.title: The Whispering River
images.description: The river whispers secrets to Meena, telling her about the world beyond.

images.title: Village and Mango Tree
images.description: A village with a mango tree, where children play and adults work.

images.title: Dadaji Notices the Missing Mangoes
images.description: Dadaji, the village elder, notices the missing mangoes and decides to catch the thief.

images.title: Dadaji Hides to Catch the Thief
images.description: Dadaji hides in the shadows to catch the thief.

images.title: Chintu is Caught
images.description: Chintu, the thief, is caught by Dadaji.

images.title: Dadaji Shows Kindness
images.description: Dadaji shows kindness to Chintu and helps him and gives mangoes for his mother.

images.title: Happy Ending with Children Picking Mangoes
images.description: The children pick mangoes from the tree and share them with their families.

images.title: Lily's Playful Day in the Meadow
images.description: Lily, a cheerful white bunny, plays with her friends (a squirrel, bird, and rabbit) in a sunny meadow filled with flowers.

images.title: Lily Chases Fireflies at Sunset
images.description: As the sun sets, Lily stubbornly chases fireflies, ignoring the rising moon’s gentle glow.

images.title: The Moon's Gentle Whisper
images.description: The moon speaks to Lily, urging her to rest, its soft light wrapping around her like a comforting blanket.

images.title: Lily's Cozy Burrow Bed
images.description: Lily curls up in her hay-lined burrow, listening to the night breeze’s lullaby as moonlight streams through the window.

images.title: Lily's Dreamland Adventure
images.description: Lily dreams of floating on clouds, surrounded by twinkling stars and the smiling moon.

images.title: Morning Joy with Friends
images.description: Energetic after a good night’s sleep, Lily leaps through the dew-covered meadow with her friends at sunrise.

leo_learns_to_do_it_himself.title: Leo Learns to Do It Himself

images.title: Leo Wakes Up Ready to Learn
images.description: Leo, a cheerful little boy, sits up in bed, stretching his arms and smiling, ready to start the day.

images.title: Leo Tries to Get Dressed
images.description: Leo struggles to put on his red shirt, accidentally getting his head stuck in the sleeve, giggling as he tries again.

images.title: Leo Brushes His Teeth
images.description: Leo stands at the bathroom sink, brushing his teeth with too much toothpaste but smiling as he learns.

images.title: Leo Pours Water Carefully
images.description: Leo, with a concentrated expression, carefully pours water into a cup, spilling a little but trying again.

images.title: Leo Puts On His Shoes
images.description: Leo sits on the floor, looking down at his shoes, realizing he has put them on the wrong feet.

images.title: Leo Peels a Banana for Snack
images.description: Leo holds a banana with both hands, peeling it with excitement as he prepares his own snack.

images.title: Leo Snuggles into Bed
images.description: Leo, tucked under a cozy blanket, yawns and smiles, feeling proud of all he did today.

the_day_the_words_got_mixed_up.title: The day the words got mixed-up

images.title: Leo, the lion cub
images.description:
Leo was a happy little lion cub. He loved running, jumping, and playing. 
 But sometimes… when things didn’t go his way, his feelings got really big.

images.title: The day of big feelings
images.description:
One morning at school, Leo was building a tall block tower. Just when he was about to put the last block, Teacher Owl said, "Leo, it’s time to clean up." 
Leo didn’t want to clean up. His tummy got tight. His face got hot. His feelings felt too big. And suddenly his words got mixed up! Instead of saying "I’m upset!", Leo shouted "BAD TEACHER!"  
The classroom got very quiet. Teacher Owl didn’t get angry. She stayed very calm and said, "Leo, I think you’re feeling upset. It’s okay to feel upset. But calling people bad hurts their hearts. Next time, you can say: I’m upset. I need help."

images.title: Mama Lion's secret
images.description:
After school, he told Mama Lion what happened. Mama Lion gave him a warm hug and said, "Feelings can get big sometimes. You are not a bad lion. You are a learning lion." 
Then she whispered a secret, "When angry words want to jump out of your mouth, take a deep lion breath and say the magic words, "I’m upset. I need help." 
Leo practiced with Mama — big lion breath, then calm magic words.

images.title: Big feelinngs again
images.description:
The next day, Leo was coloring at school. He was making a beautiful rainbow when Teacher Owl said, "Leo, it’s time to line up." 
Leo felt his tummy tighten again. The angry words tried to jump out -- "BAD—!". 
 But he stopped.

images.title: The magic words
images.description:
He remembered Mama’s lion breath. He took a deep breath… Roooooar… and said, "I’m upset. I need a minute." Teacher Owl smiled, "You used calm words! When you’re ready, you can join us." 
Leo felt proud — bigger and braver than any roar. 
That evening, Leo told Mama Lion what happened. Mama Lion kissed his head and said, "You used your strong words, not your hurt words. That’s what brave lions do." 
 Leo curled up happily, thinking "feelings can be big… and I can still be kind".
